remarks: If the metric ` D ` is "strongly finer" than ` C ` (meaning that there is a positive real constant ` R ` such that ` C ( x , y ) <_ R x. D ( x , y ) ` ), then ` D ` generates a finer topology.  (Using this theorem twice in each direction states that if two metrics are strongly equivalent, then they generate the same topology.)  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Sep-2015.)
statement:

metss2.3 $e |- ( ph -> R e. RR+ ) $.
metss2.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. X /\ y e. X ) ) -> ( x C y ) <_ ( R x. ( x D y ) ) ) $.
metss2 $p |- ( ph -> J C_ K ) $.
